data.meta_description: Friday night Twin Cities Finance Women gathered for happy hour downtown at the Hewing Hotel. Takes some effort these days to leave the comforts of work from…
data.text:
Attention all Female Founders who did not make Forbes 30 under 30 but are indeed under 30 (don't ask me why, I didn't make the rules): You are eligible for the $25K Bold Beginnings grant! Apply by 8/31/23 Details Below ⬇️ Who can apply? Anyone who identifies as a woman under 30 who currently resides across North America. https://lnkd.in/efwfh2WE Do I need to have a company, or is an idea enough? You don’t have to have a fully incorporated company or be finished building/creating your product, but you’ll need to show that you’ve taken action toward bringing to life your clear vision. How does the $25,000 grant work? The “winner” of the Share Your Vision portion of Bold Beginnings will receive $25,000. We do not take equity in your company. Where do I have to live to be part of Bold Beginnings? North America - If you are chosen and do not reside in Vancouver, BC, where Bold Beginnings takes place, flights and accommodation will be taken care of. How many women are chosen for Bold Beginnings? 8-10 women will be chosen to take part in Bold Beginnings yearly. What is the age limit to apply? Anyone aged 30 or younger. When is the application deadline? Applications will close on August 31st, and those selected will be notified in early September. Apply here: https://lnkd.in/efwfh2WE #femalefounder #grantfunding #fundraising #startup

Today is Give to Women and Girls Day. You might be thinking "Oh great, another day with a hashtag,". Well, I hear you, but also, if you pay attention to any of these days we mark on social media, I hope it's this one. I hope today is the day you give to organizations that support women and girls. It matters. Here is why: Being female is the quickest path to poverty in the U.S. Just BEING FEMALE. Being a single mom simply amplifies the likelihood. But there is hope: By investing in women, you pave the way for a stronger economy for us all. From the Gates Foundation in the Economist - https://lnkd.in/gjYzKp-n “Decades of research have shown that when women can fully participate in economies, it increases financial stability for their households, helps families recover more quickly from shocks and supports a country’s resilience. The data show a correlation between women’s economic agency and reduced poverty, and experts consider such agency essential to food security. What’s more, it fuels growth: new figures from Eurasia Group indicate that if policymakers prioritised investments in women’s economic power, the global economy could grow by an additional 7%, or $10trn, by 2030.” That means that investing in women and girls isn't just about being a good person, or helping women and girls out of the kindness of your heart — it's a strategic investment in our collective futures. Why wouldn’t we want women to have more access to money as women make the majority of household purchases (big and small). Today is about action. Make today the day you invest in women and girls, and in turn all of us. And thank you to all of the businesses and people who already realized this is a good investment and have joined the Working for Women community. To name a few with presence here on Linked In. ZS Paramount The Bloc Third Eye Associates, Ltd MemoryFox Roxana (ROX) Frontini HN Haus Smart Sister Finance Samara Daly Angie Byrnes Katie Johnston, MBA Irene Berner, MBA, CFP®, CDFA® Katy Dwyer Michelle Hynes, M.Ed., adam robinson, Jennifer Matthews, Komal Gurnani, Nicole Smith, Jennifer (Tishman) Willey That is how change is made by investing together. Come join us! #GiveToWomenAndGirls https://lnkd.in/gBz8SUsF

As we conclude Women's History Month, we want to share with you a message and valuable advice from the women of the GNEC team. Desiree Sealey, Director of Operations, encourages women entrepreneurs to stay strong, work hard and never give up. Khady Ndiaye, Development and Communications Director, advises women entrepreneurs to embrace their uniqueness and leverage their background experiences as an edge. Connie Astudillo, Operations Associate encourages women to work hard and to never stop learning. As we close out on Women's History Month, let's remember that our support for women and women-owned businesses should not be limited to just one month. It is important to keep the momentum going and uplift women entrepreneurs all year round! While Women's History Month serves as a dedicated time to celebrate the remarkable achievements of women, it is equally important to sustain our support this month and beyond. Let’s continue to celebrate, uplift, and empower women entrepreneurs every day of the year. #GNEC #SupportWomen #womenhistorymonth #WomenEntrepreneurs #WomenInBusiness #WomenEmpowerment #WomenOwnedBusinesses #GNEC #newarkcdfi #NewarkNJ #Greaternewark #nj #communitydevelopment #helpingentrepreneursthrive #empoweringentrepreneurs #gnecnj #newjersey #BusinessEmpowerment #NonProfit #empowerentrepreneurs
